definition: horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Recurvature follows after it traverses the ridge axis.
sentences.chinese: 预料尼伯特将于横过副高脊线后开始转向。

sentences.english: The old woman walked across the road in small steps.
sentences.chinese: 那位老太太步履蹀躞地横过马路。

sentences.english: After crossing Owl Creek, on the road to Poplar Cove, there are three large trees.
sentences.chinese: 后横过道路奥尔河，杨树湾，有三个大的树木。

sentences.english: TYPICAL USE:The climber traversed a long horizontal crack in the face of the mountain slope.
sentences.chinese: 登山者横过山表斜坡上的水平裂缝。

sentences.english: You can find deep knife scar across his face.
sentences.chinese: 你能发现横过他脸部的深深的刀疤。

sentences.english: While crossing the street, you must be careful.
sentences.chinese: 当你横过马路时，一定要小心。

sentences.english: That old woman crossed the road at a snail's pace.
sentences.chinese: 那个老太太横过马路时，走得慢极了。

sentences.english: Be those old men walking across the street?
sentences.chinese: 那些老大爷在横过马路吗？

sentences.english: Long streamers of Northern Lights flashing blue wisps across the sky.
sentences.chinese: 北极光的狭长流光，闪射出蓝色的光芒，横过夜空。

sentences.english: A great star came out over the white cherry trees.
sentences.chinese: 一颗明星横过白色的樱桃树爬上了夜空。

sentences.english: He saw me and came to me across the road.
sentences.chinese: 他看见了我，便横过马路向我走来。

sentences.english: It is only some sizes of pebbles, ellipsis like that river crossing.
sentences.chinese: 那其实只是些大小不一的卵石，删节号似的横过那河。

sentences.english: Keep your shoulders relaxed and cross your left arm over your chest.
sentences.chinese: 把你的肩膀放松，然后将左臂举起，横过胸前。

sentences.english: Look around before crossing the streets.
sentences.chinese: 在横过马路的时候先朝各方向看看。

sentences.english: Keep your shoulders relaxed and cross your right arm over your chest.
sentences.chinese: 把你的肩膀放松，然后将右臂举起，横过胸前。

definition: to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
pedestrian/traveler on foot/passer-by/official responsible for arranging audiences with the emperor
to go straight/straight forward/fig. to do right
to turn/to go around a corner
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to step aside (for a passing vehicle)/to get out of the way/to make way for
(of two vehicles traveling in opposite directions) to pass by each other
